drupalNodeEvent.title: A View from Across the Pacific: Chinese Perceptions of the United States

field_speakers.processed: Thomas Fingar (Stanford University), Jia Qingguo (Peking University), Wang Dong (Peking University)

field_organizers.processed: China Program, Shorenstein Asia-Pacific Research Center, Stanford Center at Peking University, Stanford University

field_description.processed: A large amount of ink has been spilled in the last few years--and even more so since COVID-19--in the U.S. regarding American perceptions of the P.R.C. Relatively little, however, has been conveyed regarding how China might view the U.S. today. In this talk, we bring together two eminent professors, Professor Jia Qingguo and Professor Wang Dong, from the School of International Studies, Peking University, to examine how policymakers, professionals, and average citizens in China might perceive the United States and what that might imply for the U.S.-China bilateral relationship. Dr. Thomas Fingar, Shorenstein APARC Fellow, will moderate the conversation.
